comment_by: How To Make Science Projects For Kids
comment_text:
What a wonderful video! Thanks for all the great info!

#science #STEM #kids #family #education #homeschool

We don’t literally have red cones but yellow cones instead. 
In fact, what we see as red is just an interpretation of our brain when our cones encounter “deep low yellow”.

I know it’s a common mistake due to habit, but biology is not painting. 
Our cones are specialized in blue (S type), green (M type) and yellow (L type).


Some animals see in two colors, or four, or even five... with a bit of ultraviolet and/or infrared.
The mantis shrimp (a crustacean) can see in twelve to sixteen different colors.
